Package com.APP.Project.UserCoreLogic.constants.interfaces

Class Order

java.lang.Object
com.APP.Project.UserCoreLogic.constants.interfaces.Order
Direct Known Subclasses:
AdvanceOrder, AirliftOrder, BlockadeOrder, BombOrder, DeployOrder, NegotiateOrder
public abstract class Order extends Object
This interface provides the methods to be implemented by different orders.
Version:
2.0
Author:
Bhoomiben Bhatt

  • Constructor Details

    • Order

      public Order()
      Constructs an Order and determines its execution and expiry indices based on the order type.

      For orders of type 'negotiate', special handling is applied to set the execution and expiry indices to ensure they are processed in a timely manner and their effects are short-lived.

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public abstract void execute() throws InvalidOrderException, CardNotFoundException
      Executes the order logic during the GameLoopState#EXECUTE_ORDER phase.

      This method should contain the core logic for order execution, including any game state modifications and validations. Implementations must handle possible exceptions related to invalid order parameters or conditions.

      Throws:
      InvalidOrderException - If the order cannot be executed due to invalid conditions.
      CardNotFoundException - If required cards for the order are not found.

    • getType

      public abstract OrderTypes getType()
      Returns the type of the order as defined by the OrderTypes enum.
      Returns:
      The specific OrderTypes value representing this order's type.

    • getExecutionIndex

      public int getExecutionIndex()
      Retrieves the execution index for this order.
      Returns:
      The index indicating when this order is scheduled for execution.

    • getExpiryIndex

      public int getExpiryIndex()
      Retrieves the expiration index for this order.
      Returns:
      The index after which this order's effects are considered expired, or -1 if the order does not expire.

    • expire

      public abstract void expire()
      Reverses the effect of this order or marks it as expired if it has previously been executed.

      This method is intended to be overridden by subclasses to implement logic for undoing or nullifying the effects of an order, typically used for orders with temporary effects.
